title: Cultivate Your Own Edamame: A Guide to Growing and Enjoying Soybeans!

tasks.task: Growing and Harvesting Soybeans or Edamame
subtasks: Preparing the soil by mixing compost, peat moss, and perlite
Planting 6-8 soybean seeds in a whiskey barrel container
Alternately, purchasing soybean transplants from a local nursery
Planting 6 transplants in a 2 and a half cubic feet whiskey barrel container
Providing full sun (at least six to eight hours) for the soybeans
Applying organic liquid fertilizer and worm tea every two weeks during growth
Protecting plants from insects (e.g., caterpillars) and diseases (e.g., rust and spider mites) using neem oil
Spraying neem oil on both sides of the leaves and the plant base weekly
Harvesting soybean pods when they mature
Removing the entire plant after harvesting the pods
Checking for nitrogen-fixing bacteria in the roots (if interested)
Tossing the soybeans (with pods) in salt and oil
Preheating an air fryer to 375 degrees Fahrenheit
Cooking soybean pods for 15-20 minutes, tossing midway
Enjoying the roasted edamame as a savory snack
